thread.title: Oct. 1 TV Picks: The new ‘The Player’ on NBC
thread.title_full: Oct. 1 TV Picks: The new ‘The Player’ on NBC | The Seattle Times

author: Doug Knoop
title: Oct. 1 TV Picks: The new ‘The Player’ on NBC
text:
‘The Player’ This new series from the producers of the popular “The Blacklist” feels a bit like the late-’70s show “Vega$” (yes, there was a dollar sign in the title). In this show, Philip Winchester plays “former military operative turned security expert” Alex Kane who seems to be at the mercy of a mystery organization while trying to stop crimes in $in City. Wesley Snipes and Charity Wakefield co-star. 10 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 1, on NBC.

Doug Knoop: dknoop@seattletimes.com or on Twitter @dougknoop 

Also on Thursday Most Read Stories ‘Heartbroken’ parents of toddler killed in Bellevue to return to India Man charged with breaking $120K Chihuly sculpture in Tacoma Time running out on Seattle family’s ‘golden ticket’ to landing home State alleges Duck in crash was operated in ‘unsafe manner’ Seahawks film review: Chancellor’s impact, fullback play and more Unlimited Digital Access. $1 for 4 weeks. “NWSL Soccer,” 6:30 p.m. (FS1): FC Kansas City vs. Seattle Reign FC: From Providence Park in Portland, Ore. (Live).
“Grey’s Anatomy,” 8 p.m. (ABC): Bailey takes on her first day as chief; April’s marriage is in trouble and she struggles to face her problems; Meredith juggles her responsibilities; Amelia tries to define her relationship with Owen.
“Sleepy Hollow,” 9 p.m. (Fox): Abbie and Crane seem to have moved on with their lives until a mysterious tablet reveals a new dark prophecy.
“Project Runway,” 9 p.m. (Lifetime): The designers must create ready-to-wear looks to be reproduced and sold online; a disagreement between the judges leads to the most contentious runway yet.
“Married,” 10:30 p.m. (FX): Russ and his assistant start to get too close; Lina and AJ work together on a children’s play about the dangers of addiction.
“Miss Fisher’s Murder Mysteries,” 10:33 p.m. (KCTS): A ghostly message spells death for a war veteran.
The New York Times
